overview: Full overhaul of the Bulletin Builder application including UI/UX redesign, performance improvements, code cleanup, bug fixes, and major feature expansions to enable element-based email building while preserving strict email export rules.

phases.name: Codebase Cleanup & Stability
phases.goal: Remove unused files, reorganize modules, and ensure all imports are valid with no missing dependencies.

tasks.description: Identify and delete unused Python files, images, and assets from the repository.
Fix broken imports such as 'bulletin_builder.menu' and ensure all modules load without error.
Remove redundant UI components such as duplicate 'Save as Component' buttons.
Fix Tkinter geometry manager conflicts by ensuring each container uses either grid or pack, not both.
Resolve all 'clear_editor_panel' related stacking issues by replacing panels instead of appending.

phases.name: UI/UX Overhaul
phases.goal: Modern, consistent, themeable UI with improved usability for all sections.

tasks.description: Implement a theme system with Light, Dark, and Hybrid modes, selectable in settings.
Redesign the layout for better section navigation â€” left panel for sections, right panel for editor, status bar at bottom.
Add a responsive layout so the app scales correctly on different resolutions.
Ensure all buttons, icons, and labels use consistent styling and spacing.
Add tooltips and hover states for all interactive elements.
Improve accessibility with proper font sizes, color contrast, and keyboard navigation.

phases.name: Performance Optimization
phases.goal: Make the app faster and more responsive by reducing load times and preventing unnecessary re-renders.

tasks.description: Lazy-load section content only when selected.
Cache loaded assets and templates in memory to avoid redundant file reads.
Profile startup and remove any heavy blocking operations.
Optimize image loading and resizing in the WYSIWYG editor.
Ensure smooth drag-and-drop for components and section reordering.

phases.name: Element-Based Email Builder
phases.goal: Allow adding modular content elements without automatically generating Table of Contents entries.

tasks.description: Add toolbar buttons for H1, H2, paragraph text, single image (portrait or landscape), two-column, and three-column layouts.
Allow drag-and-drop to position elements within a section.
Ensure added elements do not auto-link to TOC unless explicitly marked by the user.
Enable style editing for each element, respecting email-safe rules.
Implement copy, duplicate, and delete actions for each element.

phases.name: Strict Email Export Compliance
phases.goal: Ensure exported HTML emails always follow compatibility rules unless overridden.

tasks.description: Automatically set margin:0; padding:0; for all and elements.
Set table cells to border=0, cellpadding=0, cellspacing=0 by default.
Allow per-element exceptions only when explicitly set by the user.
Ensure all inline CSS is applied for maximum email client compatibility.
Run an automated validation step before export to catch non-compliant elements.

phases.name: New Features & Quality of Life
phases.goal: Add actually useful, user-requested features to improve workflow.

tasks.description: Add a real-time preview panel for both desktop and mobile email views.
Add undo/redo support in the WYSIWYG editor.
Enable saving and reusing custom elements as components.
Integrate an AI helper for quick copy suggestions, image alt text, and accessibility checks.
Add export to both HTML and ready-to-send email package formats.

phases.name: Testing & Final Polish
phases.goal: Ship with zero runtime errors and a clean, optimized user experience.

tasks.description: Run full unit and integration test coverage for core modules.
Test email output in major email clients (Outlook, Gmail, Apple Mail).
Test all supported operating systems and screen resolutions.
Remove all debug logging unless in development mode.
Update documentation and create a quickstart guide.

constraints: Email exports must always follow strict compatibility rules unless explicitly overridden.
UI must remain responsive and usable at all supported screen sizes.
No breaking changes to saved bulletin files unless migration logic is provided.
